keyMoments.title: Receives Swords from Perona
keyMoments.description: Perona, frustrated with Zoro's poor sense of direction preventing him from finding his hidden swords, gives up and returns them to him directly.
keyMoments.significance: Highlights Zoro's notorious directional challenges and his developing dynamic with Perona on Kuraigana Island.

keyMoments.title: Discovers the Giant Gravestone
keyMoments.description: Zoro and Perona stumble upon an enormous cross-shaped gravestone, a remnant of the fallen Shikkearu Kingdom on Kuraigana Island.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Zoro's eventual encounter with Mihawk and foreshadows the island's history and his future training location.

keyMoments.title: Encounters the Humandrills
keyMoments.description: Zoro is attacked by weapon-wielding baboons called Humandrills who learned combat techniques from observing a war nine years prior.
keyMoments.significance: First encounter with creatures that will later become part of his training regimen under Mihawk during the timeskip.

relationships.description: Perona accompanies Zoro on Kuraigana Island, helping him despite their initially antagonistic relationship from Thriller Bark.

evolutionMoments.description: Perona returns Zoro's swords and accompanies him toward the sea, showing a reluctant camaraderie.

keyMoments.title: Learns of Debt to Harahettania
keyMoments.description: Brook is informed by Pekkori and the people of Namakura Island about their desire to repay the debt of gratitude they owe him for defeating the Longarm Tribe.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Brook's moral character and sets up his decision to delay reuniting with the crew.

keyMoments.title: Decides to Repay His Debt
keyMoments.description: Brook chooses to remain on Namakura Island to help the people of Harahettania before reuniting with Luffy and the crew, demonstrating his honorable nature.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Brook's character development and commitment to honor, setting up his kidnapping by the Longarm Tribe and eventual career as Soul King.
keyMoments.quote: I must repay the debt I owe to these people before I can return to my crew.

keyMoments.title: Brook's Panty Request
keyMoments.description: Using his status as the supposed 'Satan' summoned by the cultists, Brook humorously requests to see women's underwear.
keyMoments.significance: Provides comic relief while maintaining Brook's signature perverted character trait.

keyMoments.title: Returns Zoro's Swords
keyMoments.description: Frustrated with waiting for Zoro to find his hidden swords due to his poor navigation skills, Perona gives up her game and returns them directly to him.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Perona's softer side and her developing relationship with Zoro on Kuraigana Island.

keyMoments.title: Accompanies Zoro to the Sea
keyMoments.description: Perona travels with Zoro through the foggy ruins of Kuraigana Island as he attempts to reach the sea and return to Sabaody Archipelago.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates her willingness to help Zoro despite their former antagonistic relationship.

relationships.description: Despite their initially antagonistic relationship from Thriller Bark, Perona helps Zoro on Kuraigana Island.

evolutionMoments.description: Perona returns Zoro's swords and accompanies him, showing a tsundere-like concern for his wellbeing.
